Title.evidence: High-Dose Selenium in Cardiac Surgery: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This international, multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Adult cardiac surgery patients with a EuroSCORE II predicted mortality of 5% or more

Intervention.evidence: high-dose intravenous selenium (2000 Î¼g/L sodium selenite) or placebo

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the number of days alive and free from organ dysfunction within 30 days post-surgery

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was web-based, stratified by site, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1416 patients were randomized, with 697 in each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: 1394 were analyzed using an intention-to-treat approach

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups, with 8.2% in the selenium group and 8.6% in the placebo group experiencing at least one serious adverse event

Funding.evidence: The trial was funded by [source not specified in the manuscript]
